channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: TV Micro RGB ou Mini RGB avec ou sans fil, on vous explique les nouvelles gammes LG LCD de 2026
item.description: Si on connait très bien LG pour la qualité de ses téléviseurs OLED, la marque explore également d’autres technologies d’affichage dont le Micro RGB et le Mini RGB à travers 3 nouvelles séries en 2026. En voici tous les détails.

item.title: Amazon’s Relentless Growth Brings Cybernetically Enhanced War in This Poignant Sci-Fi Story
item.description: Read 'Mother's Hip' by Corey Jae White and Maddison Stoff right here on io9.

item.title: Satechi unveils Thunderbolt 5 docking station that doubles as external SSD — shame it doesn't take HDDs, and why doesn't it have video outputs anyway?
item.description: Satechi CubeDock combines Thunderbolt 5, integrated NVMe SSD, high-wattage charging, and multiple ports into a compact desktop hub.

item.title: I flew the Star Wars Death Star trench run on the Sphere in a Lego X-Wing — and nothing else comes close
item.description: Lego turned the Sphere into a brick-built Death Star, and I got to fly the iconic Star Wars trench run across its massive exterior screen from a life-size, partially brick-built X-Wing parked nearby

item.title: Nvidia partner wants to 'beautify' data centers with the Infinity Cube concept — plans to cram 86TB DDR5 and 224 B200 GPU in a liquid-cooled 14ft cube
item.description: Infinity Cube consolidates multiple Omnia AI supercomputers into a 14ft liquid-cooled cube with extreme GPU, CPU, and memory density.

item.title: Here’s When Elon Musk Will Finally Have to Reckon With His Nonconsensual Porn Generator
item.description: It would be deeply embarrassing if the law has to go into effect before X acts.

item.title: Governments grapple with the flood of non-consensual nudity on X
item.description: For the past two weeks, X has been flooded with AI-manipulated nude images, created by the Grok AI chatbot — and governments around the world are promising to take action.

item.title: Don’t Sleep on ‘MAD,’ One of the Wildest Sci-Fi Manga Out Now
item.description: 'MAD' is basically what would happen if 'Alien: Earth' was a manga and its battles were on par with 'Chainsaw Man' and 'Jujutsu Kaisen.'

item.title: The best earbuds we’ve tested for 2026
item.description: It’s hard to buy a bad pair of wireless earbuds these days, and with constant discounts and deals wherever you look, now is as good a time as any to splurge on the pair you’ve been eyeing. The market has come a long way since the early era of true wireless earbuds, when we had […]

item.title: How to watch A Thousand Blows — stream Stephen Graham boxing drama online from anywhere
item.description: Want to watch A Thousand Blows from anywhere? Stream every brutal showdown as Hezekiah navigates the fight to survive London’s bare-knuckle underworld.

item.title: LG propose aussi des TV géants jusqu’à 115 pouces
item.description: Lors du CES 2026 LG a présenté deux nouvelles séries de téléviseurs LCD utilisant un système de rétroéclairage Mini LED, les QNED85 et QNED90 qui monte jusqu’à 115 pouces et dont voici tous les détails.

item.title: How AI will make behavioral health more human in 2026
item.description: AI is reshaping behavioral health by supporting clinicians and strengthening patient relationships. While headlines about AI replacing workers dominated 2025, behavioral health is charting a different path. The industry thrives on human connection, measuring success in trust, healing, and human relationships, not throughput. That’s not to say AI isn’t rapidly reshaping the industry—it is. Its role here fundamentally differs because it supports clinicians rather than sidelines them....

item.title: Long-term mortgage rate ticks up slightly to 6.16%
item.description: The recent pullback in mortgage rates has been helpful for home shoppers who can afford to buy at current rates. The average rate on a 30-year U.S. mortgage edged higher this week to just above its 2025 low.

item.title: Handwriting is my new favorite way to text with the Meta Ray-Ban Display glasses
item.description: When Meta first announced its display-enabled smart glasses last year, it teased a handwriting feature that allows users to send messages by tracing letters with their hands. Now, the company is starting to roll it out, with people enrolled in its early access program getting it first,I got a chance to try the feature at CES and it made me want to start wearing my Meta Ray-Ban Display glasses more often. When I reviewed the glasses last year, I wrote about how one of my favorite tings about the neural band is that it reduced my reliance on voice commands. I've always felt a bit self conscious...

item.title: Disney+ Adding TikTok-Style Vertical Videos to Attract the Kids
item.description: Those movies and stuff are too wide and long to be real content.

item.title: Dell unveils 52-inch pseudo-6K monitor that's bound to give you a neck torticollis — but if you want a true 6K experience, don't buy it
item.description: Dell’s 52-inch UltraSharp monitor offers four virtual desktops, a wide IPS Black panel, extensive ports, and ergonomic adjustments, but lacks true 6K resolution.

item.title: IXI’s autofocusing lenses are almost ready to replace multifocal glasses
item.description: While wave upon wave of smartglasses and face-based wearables crash on the shores of CES, traditional glasses really haven’t changed much over the hundreds of years we’ve been using them. The last innovation, arguably, was progressive multifocals that blended near and farsighted lenses — and that was back in the 1950s. It makes sense that autofocusing glasses maker IXI thinks it’s time to modernize glasses. After recently announcing a 22-gram (0.7-ounce) prototype frame, the startup is here in Las Vegas to show off working prototypes of its lenses, a key component of its autofocus glasses, whi...

item.title: Why a Chinese Robot Vacuum Company Spun Off Not One but 2 EV Brands
item.description: The pivot doesn’t look out of place at CES, where Chinese electronics companies are increasingly applying their manufacturing prowess to new industries.

item.title: 2026 could well be the year of the $500 32GB DDR5 memory module — experts predict DDR will go up by 60% in Q1 2026 alone
item.description: 2026 could see 32GB DDR5 memory costing $500 as analysts warn of steep DRAM price rises driven by server demand.
